Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders

package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders
Build-time and setup documentation for the model builder components in io.github.ai4ci.abm.builders.

This package contains abstractions and helpers used to construct a runnable simulation from configuration inputs. It primarily exposes the AbstractModelBuilder that coordinates a five-stage build process (setup, baselining and initialisation) for both the outbreak-level model and each individual agent. The rest of the package contains concrete builders and utility helpers used by experiments to produce a configured Outbreak.

High-level build stages

The model construction proceeds in five logical stages, invoked by the AbstractModelBuilder (see its do* methods):

  1. setupOutbreak — installs the SetupConfiguration on the ModifiableOutbreak, creates the container for people (a ThreadSafeArray<Person>), and constructs the social network structure (the SocialRelationship list). This stage is responsible for structural configuration such as spatial helpers (Hilbert coordinate mapping), population size and any static layout that the simulation requires.
  2. baselineOutbreak — populates non-dynamic, outbreak-wide baseline values (producing an ImmutableOutbreakBaseline) such as disease baseline parameters, default policy/behaviour state names, contact-detection probabilities, and global scalars or caps. This stage assumes the setup stage has completed and the social network is available.
  3. baselinePerson — executed once per agent to assign static person-level parameters and baselines (producing an ImmutablePersonBaseline). Typical outputs from this stage include: demographic attributes (PersonDemographic), baseline mobility / compliance modifiers, baseline susceptibility and transmissibility modifiers, default behaviour state machine assignment, and any per-person tuning derived from external data or sampling procedures.
  4. initialiseOutbreak — constructs the initial runtime ImmutableOutbreakState, linking the ExecutionConfiguration (available tests, vaccine definitions, screening probabilities, timing assumptions) and setting initial policy state machine choices or schedules.
  5. initialisePerson — the final per-agent initialisation that produces the runtime PersonState. This combines baseline values, any seeding rules, and initial in-host/risk model initial conditions. The initialiser also primes the agent's StateMachine with the baseline behaviour.

Model composition: how to customise the default builder

The package provides a ready‑made concrete builder DefaultModelBuilder that composes a small set of default fragments. Each fragment is an interface that implements a single concern with a default method — for example DefaultNetworkSetup, DefaultOutbreakBaseliner, DefaultPersonBaseliner and the DefaultInHost*Initialiser interfaces. This organisation makes it straightforward to swap behaviour by either replacing a fragment or by subclassing the default builder.

Recommended extension patterns (in increasing order of flexibility):

  1. Subclass DefaultModelBuilder and override a small number of delegation methods such as DefaultModelBuilder.setupOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak, io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) or DefaultModelBuilder.initialisePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) when you need a targeted change.
  2. Compose a new concrete builder by implementing or mixing different small interfaces. For example implement a custom DefaultNetworkSetup to alter spatial placement while keeping the standard person baselining behaviour.
  3. Use a factory or dependency injection at experiment bootstrap (for example in ExecutionBuilder) to select a concrete AbstractModelBuilder implementation at runtime. This is the most flexible approach when you need dynamic selection of builders based on experiment configuration.

Practical hints:

  • When composing fragments ensure the final concrete builder implements the set of interfaces required by the orchestration code — for example DefaultPersonInitialiser expects the specialised in‑host initialiser interfaces to be available.
  • Prefer composition (small interfaces) over large monoliths: unit tests and mocking are far easier for small focused interfaces.
  • Keep heavy IO or slow lookups in the setup or baselining stage so that per‑person initialisation remains fast and parallelisable.

Configuration → builder → ABM mapping

The table below documents common configuration entries in io.github.ai4ci.config, which builder method consumes them and which ABM class or field is ultimately set. Use the links to jump to the implementation that performs the mapping.

Mapping from configuration to ABM via builders
Configuration source Builder consumer ABM target (field/type) Notes
SetupConfiguration.getInitialImports() DefaultPersonInitialiser.initialisePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutablePersonState.getImportationExposure() Simple uniform seeding probability used to set an importation dose.
SetupConfiguration.getNetwork() DefaultModelBuilder.setupOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak, io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ModifiableOutbreak social network structures (placement and links) Network topology and size guide agent placement and contact construction.
SetupConfiguration.getDemographics() DefaultPersonBaseliner.baselinePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutablePersonBaseline demographic attributes Demographic lookups and CSV-driven assignments typically happen here.
ExecutionConfiguration.getR0() DefaultOutbreakBaseliner.baselineOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.getViralLoadTransmissibilityParameter() Calibrated using Calibration to match population-level R0.
ExecutionConfiguration.getDefaultPolicyModel() DefaultOutbreakBaseliner.baselineOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.getDefaultPolicyState() Also used to initialise the outbreak policy state machine.
ExecutionConfiguration.getDefaultBehaviourModel() DefaultPersonBaseliner.baselinePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutablePersonBaseline.getDefaultBehaviourState() Assigned to each person's behaviour state machine during baselining.
Contact / compliance / app use probabilities (ExecutionConfiguration getters) DefaultPersonBaseliner.baselinePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutablePersonBaseline.getMobilityBaseline(), ImmutablePersonBaseline.getComplianceBaseline(), ImmutablePersonBaseline.getAppUseProbability() Sampled per person after demographic adjustment.
ExecutionConfiguration.getInHostConfiguration() DefaultPersonInitialiser.initialiseInHostModel(io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.InHostConfiguration, io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration, java.util.Optional, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler, int) Per-person InHostModelState (phenomenological, stochastic or Markov) Dispatched by the person initialiser to the specialised in‑host initialisers.
Severity / case / hospitalisation / fatality rates (ExecutionConfiguration) DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser.initialiseInHostModel(io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.MarkovStateModel, io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration, java.util.Optional, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler, int) InHostMarkovState transition probabilities Converted to per-day probabilities with the project's Conversions helpers.
Screening probabilities and trigger thresholds (ExecutionConfiguration) DefaultOutbreakInitialiser.initialiseOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutableOutbreakState screening settings and trigger values Used as conservative runtime priors for detection and policy activation.

Note: the table is illustrative rather than exhaustive. For a complete trace follow the linked methods to the small default interfaces in this package; those methods are the canonical place to find mapping logic.

Practical extension points

  • To change how agents are created or how configuration maps to individuals, extend DefaultModelBuilder and override the setup/baseline/initialise hooks, or use composition by mixing alternative default interfaces. Wire your builder into your experiment bootstrap code (for example ExecutionBuilder).
  • If you need to parameterise agents from external data sources (CSV, databases), perform that lookup in your baselinePerson implementation and use the builder to write demographic/baseline values.
  • To expose different tests or vaccines, edit the ExecutionConfiguration passed to the outbreak and ensure your baselinePerson / behaviour models consult those definitions.

Where to look next in the codebase

  • AbstractModelBuilder — the orchestrator of the five-stage build process.
  • Concrete builders in this package — examples of how to map external inputs to per-person baselines and states.
  • ModelNav — small helpers for reading configuration and baseline values during building and runtime.

Rob Challen

    Description

    High level template for constructing and initialising the simulation model.

    Default initialiser for the Markov in‑host model.

    Default initialiser for the phenomenological in‑host model.

    Default initialiser for the stochastic in‑host model.
    DefaultModelBuilder
    Default, compositional model builder that assembles the standard set of setup, baselining and initialisation behaviours from small, focused interfaces.
    DefaultNetworkSetup
    Provides a setupOutbreak default function that can be mixed and matched with other setup components to configure the setup process.
    DefaultOutbreakBaseliner
    Default logic for producing an ImmutableOutbreakBaseline from an Outbreak and execution configuration.

    Default outbreak initialisation behaviour.

    Default logic for producing a per‑person ImmutablePersonBaseline.
    DefaultPersonInitialiser
    Default person initialiser used by the compositional DefaultModelBuilder.
